Header: Accountant sentenced to 367 years in prison over two million rupee fraud
Content: The former accountant of a private company in Colombo has been sentenced to 367 years rigorous imprisonment by the Colombo High Court, after he was found guilty of defrauding over two million rupees from the company by presenting forged documents. The Colombo High Court Judge Shashi Mahendran also ordered to issue an open warrant to arrest the convicted felon, Hikkaduwa Liyanage Nandasiri, who is currently evading courts, and to produce him before the court. Delivering the verdict, the court also ordered the defendant to pay a fine of 2.1 million rupees. The Attorney General’s Department had filed indictments under 19 charges against the defendant, accusing him of committing financial fraud amounting to 2,199,130 rupees belonging to a private company in Colombo, where he had been employed. During the course of the trial, the defendant had fled while evading court and the case had proceeded in absentia.
